Detailed Description

An isotropic source.

An isotropic source is a source that delivers particles with directions uniformly distributed in emitted from any shape. It is defined using the following input 

:start source:
    library = egs_isotropic_source
    name = some_name
    :start shape:
        definition of the shape
    :stop shape:
    :start spectrum:
        definition of the spectrum
    :stop spectrum:
    charge = -1 or 0 or 1 for electrons or photons or positrons
    min theta = 80  (degree)
    max theta = 100 (degree)
:stop source:

It is worth noting that the functionality of source 3 in the RZ series of user codes or source 6 in DOSXYZnrc can be reproduced with the isotropic source from the EGSnrc C++ class library.
